config.question: In the 1920s, the New York Daily News was an example of __________.

choices.content: the new urban tabloids that fed into a fascination with tales of sexual impropriety
the decline in objective journalism and rise of politically biased media outlets
a truly “free” press, one of the first news conglomerates to operate independently within the White House Press Corps
early global media that tapped into the nations’ interest in world events following its participation in the Great War

answer_3.response: Sex became a popular topic as Victorian standards crumbled. Sophisticated city dwellers seemed to be intent on exploring a new freedom in sexual expression. Plays and novels focused on adultery, and the new urban tabloids—led by the New York Daily News—delighted in telling their readers about love nests and kept women.
